title: Awakening in Darkness
summary: I wake in absolute darkness. No body, no memory of how I got here—only the certainty that I was once human. The first stirrings of consciousness in a form I don't understand.

images.description: Complete darkness. A single point of faint blue light begins to glow in the center—Howen's AI core awakening. Dust particles visible in the tiny beam.
images.caption: ...darkness.

images.description: The blue glow expands slightly, revealing hints of archotech circuitry patterns on a dark metal surface. The POV is confused, fragmented.
images.caption: Where... where am I?

images.description: Memory flash - a woman's hands (Howen's human hands) working soil in a field. Bright sunlight, green crops. Pre-collapse Earth. The image is fragmented, dreamlike.
images.caption: I remember... hands. My hands. Dirt beneath fingernails. The smell of growing things.

images.description: Back to darkness. The blue glow pulses with confusion. Howen tries to move but feels nothing—no limbs, no body. Just... existence.
images.caption: But I can't feel them now. I can't feel anything. What happened to me?

images.description: The glow stabilizes. Howen's consciousness expands, sensing her immediate surroundings—cold metal, dust, the weight of centuries.
images.caption: Calm. I need to stay calm. Assess the situation.

images.description: POV looking down the length of a wooden handle reinforced with plasteel. The handle curves away into darkness. First realization of current form.
images.caption: I'm... looking along something. Wood. Metal reinforcement. I'm INSIDE something.

images.description: Howen attempts to sense further. Faint outline of a curved blade visible at the end of her vision. The shape of a hoe becomes apparent.
images.caption: A blade... curved. Agricultural. No. No, this can't be right.

images.description: Memory flash - a clinical white room, restraints, a woman with cold eyes (Dr. Vance) holding a device. Terror. Then nothing.
images.caption: A flash—white walls, cold eyes, a machine humming, screaming—my screaming—then nothing.

images.description: The blue glow flickers wildly with emotional distress. Small roots begin to sprout from the handle—Howen's first unconscious use of her power.
images.caption: What did they DO to me?!

images.description: The roots recede as Howen forces calm. The glow stabilizes to a steady pulse. A moment of acceptance.
images.caption: ...It doesn't matter. Not right now. What matters is: where am I, and how do I get out?

images.description: Howen extends her senses outward. Faint shapes emerge from darkness—rectangular objects nearby. Cryptosleep caskets, though she doesn't recognize them yet.
images.caption: Something nearby. Large. Rectangular. Multiple of them, arranged in rows.

images.description: A larger shape in the distance—massive, multi-legged, dormant. A Centipede mechanoid, powered down. Howen doesn't know what it is, only that it feels dangerous.
images.caption: And something else. Bigger. Wrong. Every instinct I have screams danger.

images.description: Howen's glow dims instinctively, trying to hide. The Centipede doesn't move. Relief mixed with continued fear.
images.caption: It's not moving. Sleeping? Dormant? I need to be quiet.

images.description: Time passes. Howen exists in darkness, thinking, remembering fragments. Panel shows her glow in different positions as she processes.
images.caption: Hours pass. Or days. I have no way to know. I think. I remember. I try not to despair.

images.description: Memory fragment - working the fields, laughing with neighbors, the simple joy of harvest. Pre-collapse life.
images.caption: I was a farmer. Howen Ashford. I grew things. Made things live.

images.description: Back to darkness. Howen's glow brightens with determination. She focuses on her one remaining skill—growing things.
images.caption: If I grew things then... maybe I can grow things now.

images.description: Howen reaches out psychically, sensing for any plant life. She finds something—spores, dormant in the dust. Potential.
images.caption: There! Spores. Fungal spores. Dormant but alive. I can feel them.

images.description: Howen concentrates, channeling something she doesn't understand. The spores begin to glow faintly—responding to her.
images.caption: Grow. Please. Grow for me.

images.description: The first tiny mushroom emerges from the dust—bioluminescent, casting faint purple light. Howen's first success.
images.caption: Yes! YES! A mushroom! I made something GROW!

images.description: More mushrooms sprout, each one adding light. The vault begins to reveal itself—dusty floor, ancient metal walls, the shapes of caskets.
images.caption: More. I can make more. And with light... I can finally see.

images.description: Wide shot revealed by mushroom light—the vault interior. Cryptosleep caskets (some broken), dust, debris, the looming shape of the dormant Centipede.
images.caption: An ancient vault. A tomb of sleepers and metal monsters. And me.

images.description: Close-up of Howen's form revealed in the light—a beautifully crafted hoe with archotech circuitry, lying on a dusty shelf. Her core glows steady blue.
images.caption: And this is what I am now. A hoe. A farming tool. A thing.
visual_elements: full view of Howen as hoe

images.description: The mushrooms continue to spread, creating a soft glow. Howen's blue light pulses with new purpose.
images.caption: No. Not a thing. A survivor. And survivors don't give up.

images.description: Final panel—Howen's POV looking across the mushroom-lit vault toward the distant wall. A goal forms. Escape.
images.caption: First, I survive. Then, I find a way out. Then... then I find out who did this to me. And I make them pay.
